Articles.Content:
Hello

Loving this game so much right now, even if getting into an orbit seems to escape me haha

/wanders off to explode another rocket
Hello Welcome to the forum. You can find many tutorials on youtube if you need them. Look up Scott Manley, he has many tutorial videos that can help.

Welcome,

To KSP and this fun packed place. Never be afraid to ask for help around here as people are more than happy to offer advice.

G.

Thank you for the welcome

I've watched a few of Scott Manley's videos, but I seem to be like Homer Simpson making a bowl of cereal... always spontaneously combust's haha.

Although I've been told it does make good entertainment when my friends are watching me play

Welcome to the forums!

As mentioned before, if you need any help with anything, there are tons of useful tutorials out there. I've tried to collect a few of the better ones into a place called the Drawing Board (link in my sig), along with a few other useful resources. You can also ask questions on the How To section, as the people who hang out around there tend to be very knowledgeable.

Happy landings!

And one of the items on that list is my example rocket and orbital walkthrough, which you can read/download here: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/25008-How-to-reach-orbit-and-a-rocket-that-can-do-it-a-walkthrough-for-newbies

And one of the items on that list is my example rocket and orbital walkthrough, which you can read/download here: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/25008-How-to-reach-orbit-and-a-rocket-that-can-do-it-a-walkthrough-for-newbies

Awesome, I've been making the foolish (yet humourous) attempts at flying straight up and turning when I leave the atmosphere, Ill study that when I finish work
